intro: Diotocarpus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf diotocarpus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is characterized by its slender, alternate leaves that are typically less than 5 cm in length. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, berry-like fruits. It is native to regions of South and Southeast Asia, where it thrives in moist, tropical climates. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
